item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Tuesday, September 10, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Nix 2.24+ is vulnerable to (remote) privilege escalation (54 points | 30 comments)
2. What is the best pointer tagging method? (41 points | 11 comments)
3. Redox OS 0.9.0 (58 points | 10 comments)
4. Bending Zed to render my beautiful fonts with Nix (12 points | 5 comments)
5. Nobody Cares About Security (21 points | 13 comments)
6. not quite buildless (9 points | 3 comments)
7. Apple Event for September 9th, 2024 (35 points | 6 comments)
8. Random access string compression with FSST and Rust (12 points | 7 comments)
9. OpenSSH Keystroke Obfuscation Bypass (5 points | no comments)
10. QUIC is not Quick Enough over Fast Internet (39 points | 10 comments)
11. Signatures are like backups (7 points | 1 comment)
12. Client-side, ad-free dev utils (encoder/decoder, json format/minify, pivot, time convertor, diffs, QR generator, etc.) (11 points | 5 comments)
13. Windows NT vs. Unix: A design comparison (12 points | 2 comments)
14. The Insecurity of Debian (15 points | 18 comments)
15. The stacking workflow (3 points | 4 comments)
16. Linux Very Close To Enabling Real-Time "PREEMPT_RT" Support (3 points | no comments)
17. Announcing simkube v1.0: Record-and-replay Kubernetes simulator (5 points | 1 comment)
18. Just for Fun. No, Really (22 points | 3 comments)
19. Linking can be fast (if you cheat): Roc's Surgical Linker (3 points | no comments)
20. Reclaim the stack: an Heroku replacement (17 points | 12 comments)
21. proctrace - a high level profiler for process lifecycle events (7 points | no comments)
22. The State of ES5 on the Web (14 points | 8 comments)
23. Pico SDR (14 points | no comments)
24. A Critique of Modern SQL And A Proposal Towards A Simple and Expressive Query Language (1 points | no comments)
25. CAR: Copy-on-write Archive (50 points | 33 comments)
